title: EF are selling their 2023 Dura-Ace-equipped team bikes for under £5k
content:
Cyclist
EF are selling their 2023 Dura-Ace-equipped team bikes for under £5k

EF Pro Cycling, the company that runs EF Education-EasyPost and the new women’s team EF Education-Cannondale, has put 2023 team bikes on sale at (comparatively) dirt cheap prices.

You can currently get a 2023 Cannondale SuperSix EVO 4 Hi-Mod Dura-Ace bike worth over £10,000 for just £4,491. That comes with the latest edition Shimano Dura-Ace groupset – although crankset is team-issued FSA SL-K Light rather than Shimano – FSA and Vision bar, stem and wheels, a Prologo saddle and Vittoria tyres.

Related Posts

EF Education-EasyPost’s Tour de France 2023 bike: Cannondale Lab71 SuperSix Evo

Want to ride an actual pro bike? Bike Room has you covered

Tour de France team bikes 2023: Cyclist’s complete guide

A couple of points to note is that it is the lower-spec (probably for training) aluminium wheels, but the webpage suggests you can upgrade to Vision’s SC55 Carbon wheels though it doesn’t say how much extra that is or how to upgrade. Also the bike is branded with Cannondale’s ‘Lab71’ logo, which suggests it’s the new for 2023 S-Works-esque top end frame, but that’s actually just branding, as it is actually the Hi-Mod version.

However, given that the bonus of a Lab71 frame pretty much boils down to a 40g saving, it’s not the end of the world. Plus everyone will think you do have the Lab71 version. Win, win.

It’s currently available in sizes 44 to 58 (but 56 is already sold out) and comes in team colours, but they’re not that crazy so it shouldn’t be a sticking point.

As well as that, the team’s 2023 Cannondale SystemSix Hi-Mod Dura-Ace aero bike is on sale too, albeit in fewer sizes, just 51-58. Aero frame aside the bikes on sale have the exact same spec as the SuperSix, so if you did fancy the aero wheels you’d normally see on these bikes you’d have to find those elsewhere. Again, it’s labelled Lab71 but Cannondale doesn’t have a Lab71 SystemSix on the market yet so it’s a Hi-Mod frame.

That bike is currently available for just £4,657.

For even more deals, EF also has its 2022 SystemSix Dura-Ace available for just £3,659 in sizes 47-58 and its 2022 SuperSix Ultegra for £3,742 in just a 54 and 56.

To see all the bikes and to buy, visit efbike.com.

The post EF are selling their 2023 Dura-Ace-equipped team bikes for under £5k appeared first on Cyclist.
author: Will Strickson | Deputy Website Editor
